facts: The fingerprints of koalas are so indistinguishable from humans that they have on occasion been confused at crime scenes.
The placement of a donkey's eyes in its head allows it to see all four of its legs at all times.
Penguins have an organ above their eyes that converts seawater to fresh water, allowing them to survive without drinking water for months.
Cows have best friends and become stressed when they are separated from them.
Honey never spoils - archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3000 years old and still edible.
A group of flamingos is called a "flamboyance."
A group of ferrets is called a "business."
A group of giraffes is called a "tower."
Sea otters hold hands while sleeping to prevent drifting apart.
